info.description: Use the Oracle Integration Cloud Service REST API to manage and monitor integrations, connections, lookups, and packages. You can also display environment, status, and usage information.
info.title: REST API for Oracle Integration Cloud Service, Version 1
info.x-summary: Use the Oracle Integration Cloud Service REST API to manage and monitor integrations, connections, lookups, and packages.

tags.name: connections
tags.description: Retrieve, update, manage attachments for, and delete connections.

tags.name: environment
tags.description: Retrieve ICS environment information and manage compression.

tags.name: integrations
tags.description: Retrieve, delete, export, import, activate, deactivate, and run integrations.

tags.name: monitoring
tags.description: Retrieve integration metrics and error instances and view or export the monitoring log.

tags.name: packages
tags.description: Retrieve, delete, export, and import packages.

get.description: Retrieves a list of lookups.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name or last updated time.

get.description: Retrieves a list of integrations.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters results by name, status, and type.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name or last updated time.

post.description: Imports (adds) an integration that was exported previously. Importing an integration under a different user name or version that was exported is not supported. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

put.description: Imports (replaces) an integration with the same name that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

get.description: Retrieves an integration. Results include the extended metadata for the integration, but do not include the integration in its entirety (refer to the export API).

412.description: Integration is currently activated or is not in a proper state to be activated
Integration is currently deactivated or is not in a proper state to be deactivated

get.description: Exports an integration. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.
Fetches the ESS job status.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Request ID for the ESS job

get.description: Retrieves information about the installed ICS environment, such as the version and feature mode.
Retrieves the status of a compression operation.

post.description: Starts an operation to compress all XML files. Compressing XML files improves ICS performance.

409.description: Conflict, the compression has already been started.

get.description: Retrieves a list of packages.

post.description: Imports (adds) a package that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

get.description: Retrieves a package.
Exports a package. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.
Retrieves a list of connections.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters results by name and status.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Orders results by name, last updated time, or type.

get.description: Retrieves a connection. Results include the extended metadata for the connection, but do not include the connection in its entirety.

Retrieves an attachment for a connection property. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

post.description: Uploads an attachment (such as a WSDL file) to a connection and associates the attachment with a specific connection property. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

get.description: Retrieves information about the runtime health of ICS, such as whether a component is up or down.
Retrieves metrics about ICS artifacts, such as how many integrations are configured and how many packages they have.
Retrieves a list of error instances.
Retrieves an error instance.
Retrieves a list of flow instances.
Retrieves a flow instance.
Retrieves monitoring metrics (statistics) for all integrations.
Retrieves the monitoring metrics for a single integration.
Retrieves the monitoring log.
Exports the monitoring log. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.
